top_procedures.description: Insertion of needle and/or catheter into dialysis circuit and balloon dilation of dialysis segment, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Ultrasound evaluation of blood vessel during diagnosis or treatment
Removal of plaque in artery in one leg, endovascular, accessed through the skin or open procedure
Removal of plaque and insertion of stents into arteries in one leg, endovascular, accessed through the skin or open procedure

Balloon dilation of dialysis segment, accessed through the skin, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Removal of plaque in arteries in one leg, endovascular, accessed through the skin or open procedure
Insertion of stent in vein with review by radiologist, initial vein

Excision of blood clot and/or infusion to dissolve blood clot in dialysis circuit and balloon dilation of dialysis segment, , accessed through the skin, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation, with balloon catheter
Ultrasound evaluation of blood vessel during diagnosis or treatment
Insertion of needle and/or catheter into dialysis circuit and insertion of stent in dialysis segment, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Ultrasound scan of veins of both arms or legs including assessment of compression and functional maneuvers
Ultrasound study of arteries and arterial grafts of both legs
Ultrasound scanning of blood flow (outside the brain) on both sides of head and neck
Ultrasound scan of vena cava or groin graft or vessel blood flow
Ultrasound scan of veins of one arm or leg or limited including assessment of compression and functional maneuvers
Initial hospital inpatient care, typically 70 minutes per day
Established patient office or other outpatient, visit typically 40 minutes
Moderate sedation services by physician also performing a procedure, patient 5 years of age or older, first 15 minutes
Ultrasound study of arteries and arterial grafts of one leg or limited
